triples.name: Software verification
triples.relevance: The paper organizes and evaluates state-of-the-art software verification systems and establishes standards for verification benchmarking.

triples.name: Formal verification
triples.relevance: Formal verification is the underlying method used by the 52 verification systems evaluated in the competition.

triples.name: C (programming language)
triples.relevance: The competition evaluates verification systems on 23,805 C program verification tasks.

triples.name: Java (programming language)
triples.relevance: The competition evaluates verification systems on 586 Java program verification tasks.

triples.name: Memory safety
triples.relevance: Memory safety is one of the key specifications verified in the competition tasks.

triples.name: Buffer overflow
triples.relevance: Buffer overflow detection is part of the overflow specifications tested in the competition.

triples.name: Termination analysis
triples.relevance: Termination analysis is one of the key verification specifications in the competition.

triples.name: Benchmark (computing)
triples.relevance: The competition creates and provides a comprehensive benchmark of 24,391 verification tasks for evaluating tools.
